## 3.1 Working with Vectors

Vector data in GEE is known as `ee.FeatureCollection`.

### Public Vector Datasets
You can access global boundaries directly from the Data Catalog.

```javascript
// Load Administrative Boundaries
var odisha = ee.FeatureCollection('FAO/GAUL/2015/level1')
  .filter(ee.Filter.eq('ADM1_NAME', 'Orissa')); // Note: GAUL uses old spelling

Map.addLayer(odisha, {color: 'red'}, 'Odisha Boundary');
```

## 3.2 Using Custom Assets

For your own study areas:
1.  Navigate to the **Assets** tab.
2.  Select **New** > **Shapefile**.
3.  Upload your files (`.shp`, `.shx`, `.dbf`, `.prj`).
4.  Import the asset into your script using its path.

## 3.3 Generating Charts

Charts turn pixel data into insights.

```javascript
// Load Climate Data (TerraClimate)
var climate = ee.ImageCollection('IDAHO_EPSCOR/TERRACLIMATE')
  .filterDate('2020-01-01', '2023-12-31')
  .select('tmmn'); // Minimum Temperature

// Chart Temperature over Cuttack
var tempChart = ui.Chart.image.series({
  imageCollection: climate,
  region: ee.Geometry.Point([85.82, 20.46]),
  reducer: ee.Reducer.mean(),
  scale: 1000
}).setOptions({
  title: 'Minimum Temperature Trend (Cuttack)',
  hAxis: {title: 'Date'},
  vAxis: {title: 'Min Temp (Â°C)'}
});

print(tempChart);
```
